short_summary: Procurement for the Indigenous Offender Reintegration Program. The program aims to provide culturally appropriate intervention and services to Indigenous women offenders to address the impacts of intergenerational trauma and addictions, and to develop life skills to better prepare them to contribute positively to their families and communities upon release. The services are needed both within the institutions to support the transition to the urban community, as well as within urban communities to provide ongoing support to Indigenous offenders upon release. The work involves the following objectives: (1) to improve CSCs ability to reintegrate Indigenous women offenders to urban areas; (2) to increase CSCs capacity to acquire the services of Community Organizations in the release planning process; and (3) to identify and coordinate reintegration support for Indigenous women offenders in urban areas. The contractor must serve, for up to one (1) year, a minimum of 50 Indigenous Women per year who are close to or already released (within in 90 days of their release) into the community. The contractor must ensure that they begin release planning with the woman offender a minimum 2 – 6 weeks prior to their release and ensure continuity of this plan after their transition to their community.
description: The Correctional Service Canada has a requirement for culturally appropriate intervention and services that will support Indigenous women offenders to address the impacts of intergenerational trauma and addictions and develop life skills to better prepare them to contribute positively to their families and communities upon release. These services are needed both within the institutions to support the transition to the urban community, as well as within urban communities to provide ongoing support to Indigenous offenders upon release. The work will involve the following: The Contractor must serve, for up to one (1) year, a minimum of 50 Indigenous Women per year who are close to or already, released (within in 90 days of their release) into the community. The Contractor must consult and contribute reintegration support at the earliest stage of release planning with the Institutional Parole Officer for any woman offender requiring support services into the Edmonton area or other communities identified in the release plan. The Contractor must ensure that they begin release planning with the woman offender a minimum 2 – 6 weeks prior to their release and ensure continuity of this plan after their transition to their community. The Contractor must develop a release plan that is realistic and meets all the Indigenous women’s immediate basic needs (shelter, food, finances); identify natural and professional supports, identify short and long-term personal goals such as trauma and addictions supports, family reunification; and develop short and long-term goals for independence such as employment, education. The Contractor must provide reintegration support services in institutions, or Section 81 facilities to support transition within the urban communities to provide ongoing support to Indigenous Women Offenders upon release. The Contractor must facilitate connection and supports to communities outside Edmonton Area.
duration_in_months: The contract is for a period of 1.25 years, from December 1, 2023 to March 31, 2025.
full_summary:
**Indigenous Offender Reintegration Program (IROP)**

* **Reference Number**: cb-421-75861862
* **Solicitation Number**: 50601-23-4529655
* **Publication Date**: 2023-10-10
* **Tender Closing Date**: 2023-10-26T15:00:00

**Background**

The Correctional Service Canada (CSC) seeks to enhance the reintegration of Indigenous women offenders in urban centers. The CSC has a requirement for culturally appropriate interventions and services that address intergenerational trauma, addictions, and life skills development to promote successful reintegration.

**Work Scope**

The successful contractor will provide reintegration support services for a minimum of 50 Indigenous women offenders per year, including:

1.	Developing a release plan that meets the immediate basic needs of the offender, identifies natural and professional supports, and sets short- and long-term goals for independence.
2.	Providing reintegration support services in institutions and urban communities to foster public safety and broaden the support network for Indigenous women offenders.
3.	Coordinating reintegration support for Indigenous women offenders in urban areas, including facilitating connections and supports to communities outside of the Edmonton area.
4.	Providing services such as addiction counseling, Elders' services, education, and employment to support the reintegration of Indigenous women offenders.

**Performance Standards**

The contractor must conduct the work according to CSC policies and regulations, Canadian law, and other applicable standards.

**Deliverables**

The contractor must provide the following deliverables:

1.	Monthly reports on communication and work completed with CSC personnel, services provided to Indigenous offenders, community contacts, and list of women offenders being served.
2.	Annually, a project evaluation of the Indigenous Women's Offender Reintegration Program.

**Accessibility Requirements**

Contractor personnel must be escorted at all times by CSC personnel and adhere to institutional requirements for searches prior to admittance.

**Bid Requirements**

Only Indigenous businesses, as defined in the Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB), may submit a statement of capabilities. The contractor must have a minimum of two years' experience in supporting Indigenous female offenders with conditional release planning and reintegration. The contractor must provide a statement of capabilities by 2023-10-26. Inquiries and statements of capabilities should be directed to Janet Nelson, Regional Procurement Officer.

**Contract Value**

The estimated contract value is $199,999.00 (GST/HST extra).
